quote: The dead cannot cry out for justice; it is a duty of the living to do so for them.
Every right implies a responsibility; Every opportunity, an obligation, Every possession, a duty.
No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
The line of life is a ragged diagonal between duty and desire.
'Tis a sort of duty to be rich, that it may be in one's power to do good, riches being another word for power.
A duty dodged is like a debt unpaid; it is only deferred, and we must come back and settle the account at last.
A sense of duty is useful in work, but offensive in personal relations.
Activate yourself to duty by remembering your position, who you are, and what you have obliged yourself to be.

All great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
As soon as sacrifice becomes a duty and necessity to mankind. I see no limit to the horizon which opens before him.
Because I remember, I despair. Because I remember, I have the duty to reject despair.
But in his duty prompt at every call, he watched and wept, he prayed and felt for all.
Character is a by-product; it is produced in the great manufacture of daily duty.
Consult duty not events.
Deeply consider that it is your duty and interest to read the Holy Scriptures.
Depart from discretion when it interferes with duty.
Do not look on your work as a dull duty. If you choose you can make it interesting. Throw your heart into it.
Do the duty which lies nearest to you, the second duty will then become clearer.
Do the duty which lieth nearest to thee! Thy second duty will already have become clearer.
Do your duty and a little more and the future will take care of itself.
Do your duty and leave the rest to heaven.
Do your duty, that is best; leave unto the Lord the rest.
Duty cannot exist without faith.
Duty is not collective; it is personal.
Duty is the sublimest word in the language. You can never do more than your duty. You should never wish to do less.
Duty largely consists of pretending that the trivial is critical.
Every right implies a responsibility; Every opportunity, an obligation, Every possession, a duty.
Families are nothing other than the idolatry of duty.
Fear is not a lasting teacher of duty.
Good luck is the willing handmaid of a upright and energetic character, and conscientious observance of duty.
Government's first duty is to protect the people, not run their lives.
Gratitude is a duty which ought to be paid, but which none have a right to expect.
Happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
Happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
I believe that every right implies a responsibility; every opportunity an obligation; every possession, a duty.
I take it as a man's duty to restrain himself.
I think it's the duty of the comedian to find out where the line is drawn and cross it deliberately.
I think the first duty of society is justice.
If one hears bad music, it is one's duty to drown it by one's conversation.
In everyday things the law of sacrifice takes the form of positive duty.
It is just as hard to do your duty when men are sneering at you as when they are shouting at you.
It is our duty as men and women to proceed as though the limits of our abilities do not exist.
It is the duty of government to make it difficult for people to do wrong, easy to do right.
It is the duty of the President to propose and it is the privilege of the Congress to dispose.
It is the patriotic duty of every man to lie for his country.
Laughter is much more important than applause. Applause is almost a duty. Laughter is a reward.
Leadership to me means duty, honor, country. It means character, and it means listening from time to time.
Let others laugh when you sacrifice desire to duty, if they will. You have time and eternity to rejoice in.
Let us have faith that right makes might, and in that faith let us dare to do our duty as we understand it.
Lets have faith that right makes might; and in that faith let us, to the end, dare to do our duty as we understand it.
Love can do much, but duty more.
Love is a better teacher than duty.
Marriage is the miracle that transforms a kiss from a pleasure into a duty.
May be is very well, but Must is the master. It is my duty to show justice without recompense.
Never mind your happiness; do your duty.
No eulogy is due to him who simply does his duty and nothing more.
Non-cooperation with evil is as much a duty as is cooperation with good.
Not observation of a duty but liberty itself is the pledge that assures fidelity.
Oh, duty is what one expects from others, it is not what one does oneself.
On an occasion of this kind it becomes more than a moral duty to speak one's mind. It becomes a pleasure.
Once we are destined to live out our lives in the prison of our mind, our duty is to furnish it well.
Only enemies speak the truth. Friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty.
Our duty is to be useful, not according to our desires, but according to our powers.
Our duty is to believe that for which we have sufficient evidence, and to suspend our judgment when we have not.
Our duty, as men and women, is to proceed as if limits to our ability did not exist. We are collaborators in creation.
Painting is a faith, and it imposes the duty to disregard public opinion.
Pleasure is the object, duty and the goal of all rational creatures.

Reading is not a duty, and has consequently no business to be made disagreeable.
Rights that do not flow from duty well performed are not worth having.

The first duty of an historian is to be on guard against his own sympathies.
The first duty of life is to be as artificial as possible. What the second duty is no one as yet discovered.
The first duty of love is to listen.
The first duty of man is to conquer fear; he must get rid of it, he cannot act till then.
The one duty we owe to history is to rewrite it.
The path of duty was the way to glory.
The reward of one's duty is the power to fulfill another.
The rule of joy and the law of duty seem to me all one.
The sad duty of politics is to establish justice in a sinful world.
The whole duty of government is to prevent crime and to preserve contracts.
The wretched have no compassion, they can do good only from strong principles of duty.
There is no duty we so much underrated as the duty of being happy.
There is only one duty, only one safe course, and that is to try to be right.
To be humble to superiors is duty, to equals courtesy, to inferiors nobleness.
To provoke dreams of terror in the slumber of prosperity has become the moral duty of literature.
Unless we learn to do our duty to those whom we employ, they will never learn to do their duty to us.
We must recognize that our real duty is always found running in the direction of our worthiest desires.
We never fail when we try to do our duty, we always fail when we neglect to do it.
When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty.
When I'm not thanked at all, I'm thanked enough, I've done my duty, and I've done no more.
When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.
When work is a pleasure, life is joy.! When work is a duty, life is slavery.
Without duty, life is sort of boneless; it cannot hold itself together.
Woman's first duty in life is to her dressmaker. What the second duty is no one has yet discovered.
